channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023100621
item.description:
Report X-2023100621

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on three of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. The contents were then brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The package was leaking. Once the package was opened, the caps on three of the bottles were noticed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage

item.title: Report X-2023100487
item.description:
Report X-2023100487

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, A PROPERLY MARKED AND LABELED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED A SUCCESSFUL ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN LOCATION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 9.1 LITER JUG OF DECONEX OP 141 LEAKING FROM A LOOSE CLOSURE.

item.title: Report X-2023100477
item.description:
Report X-2023100477

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKER. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED, NOTICED IT WAS A HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND PUT ON THE PROPER PPE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER PLACED ON THE SPILL CART AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSSING.

item.title: Report X-2023100536
item.description:
Report X-2023100536

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap become loose, causing a small amount on liquid to spill out. We cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose` DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.
